meanings.definition: A person's mother or father's sister.
meanings.sent1: My naunt always bakes the best cookies.
meanings.sent2: I visited my naunt over the weekend.
meanings.sent3: My naunt told a funny joke at the family gathering.
meanings.sent4: She is like a warm hug from a favorite naunt.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies always reminds me of my naunt.

meanings.definition: To tease or ridicule in a good-natured way.
meanings.sent1: We naunt each other playfully during game night.
meanings.sent2: It's all in good fun when we naunt our friends.
meanings.sent3: I naunted my brother about his funny dance moves.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter naunted him like a melody he couldn't resist.
meanings.sent5: The children naunted each other with silly faces.

meanings.definition: To be related to someone as an aunt.
meanings.sent1: I naunt my cousin through marriage.
meanings.sent2: She naunts her best friend's children with love.
meanings.sent3: Our close bond naunts us as family.
meanings.sent4: Their shared experiences naunt them like siblings.
meanings.sent5: The special connection between them naunts them as kin.
